definition: to send under escort/to transport a detainee
to mortgage/to pawn/to detain in custody/to escort and protect/(literary) to sign
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: They bound him, holding him before Ea.
sentences.chinese: 於是他們將他捆綁起來，押送到Ea跟前。

sentences.english: The police carted the criminals away to the lockup for prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 警察把罪犯用車押送到看守所。

sentences.english: Garcia was transported to the custody of the San Diego Sheriff's Department.
sentences.chinese: 後來加西亞被押送至聖地亞哥監護所。

sentences.english: King minister will divide county brigade, LiBiao will also be transferred to basis to trial.
sentences.chinese: 王部長要分開縣大隊，李彪也將被押送到依據地受審。

sentences.english: Cinqué initiates a rebellion on board the vessel.
sentences.chinese: 在被押送登船後，桑克便展開一系列的反抗。

sentences.english: Then finally there came the long journey to Rome, his first and second imprisonments and his death, apparently by execution.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他被押送到羅馬，進出監獄兩次，最終被處死。

sentences.english: The prisoners were herded (together) onto the train.
sentences.chinese: 一羣囚犯被驅趕著押送上了火車。

sentences.english: Sir Kay appears and escorts the Yankee to Camelot .
sentences.chinese: 凱伊爵士出現了，他押送這位美國佬到卡米洛。

sentences.english: You also learn that a contingent of local hostages is being held up ahead.
sentences.chinese: 你還知道了一隊當地人正在被押送向前。

sentences.english: Before the original let wells immediately go to help escort Beijing and take over the state.
sentences.chinese: 前原讓井上幫忙押送馬上花和餘本州一起去新京。

sentences.english: They arrested Zhai Tiantian and turned him over to the New Jersey police.
sentences.chinese: 他們逮捕，齋把他押送到了新澤西警方。

sentences.english: His police escort forbade him to speak to me.
sentences.chinese: 押送他的警察不讓他跟我說話。

sentences.english: The prisoner eluded his escort and showed them a clean pair of heels as he ran through the back streets of the town.
sentences.chinese: 那囚犯躲開了押送人員，穿過該城市的背街，逃走了。

definition: to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to escort (goods or funds)/to convey under guard
to receive orders/to follow orders/to act under orders
in custody/to keep sb in detention
